sentence.idiomatic: The next World Cup will be held in Brazil.
He is confident of winning the next presidential election.
A president can only serve two terms of office. Next term there will have to be a different president.
He was the one elected by everyone; he should be quite competent.
Next month is the congressional election. Who will you vote for?
The election results are out. He lost to his opponent by a difference of a few hundred votes.
Sticking it out enabled me to have the last laugh in business.
Don't be overjoyed too quickly--in the finals we'll see who gets the last laugh.
Vying for first place in the industry, who will get the last laugh?
From my youth on, I have encountered many difficulties, but I have been able to surmount them every time.
The support of his friends and family helped him to get out of his predicament.
Due to the effects of falling sales, the company fell into funding difficulties.
The attitude of both parties to the negotiation is very unyielding; neither is willing to concede.
Much of the populace feel that the government must have a stronger foreign policy. If not, it will be harmful to the country's interests.
After this tough government came into power, it instead caused the problems to become more and more serious.
The company relieved him of all his duties.
So long as you agree to this requirement you can be relieved of all your debts.
The government eliminating the agricultural tax would benefit the farmers.
A bubble economy can easily bring on economic collapse.
My computer got a virus; the whole system is fried.
On hearing the news that her family was in an accident, she just about had a total breakdown.
The government instituted a lot of favorable measures to give aid to the economy in the west.
In recent years the local government gave active support to small and medium sized businesses, enabling the regional economy to grow very quickly.
High-tech industries are this region's key supported industries, and can get tax breaks.
I'm willing to bet that in the next American presidential election the Democrats will definitely win.

Dream on. The Republicans will have the last laugh. A lot of people believe that America's current predicament was created by the Republicans. But the more serious the crisis, the more you need a strong president and policy.

Actually I'm not 100 percent satisfied with the Democratic candidate, but they're going to be better than the Republicans. They promise to reform social security, equally distribute societal resources, and eliminate the tax breaks given certain large corporations. These policies can benefit the people.

If you ask me, those are all unrealistic ideas. Although I know the Republican candidate isn't totally perfect, he's a lot more practical. For example, protecting the interests of domestic enterprises, or reducing the trade imbalance. Now that's protecting the nation's interests.

word.literal: to not be able to afford to see

sentence.idiomatic: This is exactly the reason why I don't like the GOP: it totally ignores the people's interests. It's clearly the government's policies that failed, creating such a high national deficit, but they never admit it. Look, the health care system is on the verge of collapse, and the poor just can't afford to see a doctor. The Republican Party not only doesn't help, it even wants to control insurance rates. The Democratic Party can see the root of the problem, and advocates the expansion of insurance coverage.
That's because they're not the incumbent party. It's easy to say, but where is the nation going to get all those resources?
The reason it doesn't have the resources is that the government wastes money. Just take a look at the national defense budget.
That's just looking after national security. Speaking of which, the Republican domestic security policy is also stronger than the Democrats'.

I think the Republicans only restrict normal people, but they take really good care of those with power and status. The Democrats' policies, on the other hand, are fairer. For example, raising the minimum wage, or lowering the interest rates on student loans.

You're wrong. It's only the policies of the Republican Party that can truly solve problems. Because they especially support business, they stimulate the economy. When the economy improves, employment rates go up, and the people naturally have more money.
Both those benefits are all snatched away by the wealthy. The poor get poorer, and the rich get richer. The gap between the two gets wider and wider.
Then let's just wait and see. Anyway, I will definitely support the Republican Party.
And I will absolutely choose the Democratic Party. It's time for a change.
